Questions.question: clavipectorial fascia
options: is pierced by medial pectoral nerve
Questions.explanation:
The clavipectoral fascia is a strong fascial sheet deep to pectoralis major. Its upper part, also known as the costocoracoid membrane, is attacted laterally to the coracoid process and medially blends with the external intercostal membrane of the upper two spaces.
 It encloses the pectoralis minor and subclaus. It is pierced by 4 structures namely 
 1. lymphatic from infraclavicular(deltopectorial) node to apical nodes of the axilla 
 2. cephalic vein 
 3. lateral pectoral nerve 
 4. thoracoacromial artery or its branches(clavicular, pectoral, acromial and deltoid)

Questions.question: Structures present at the roof of the cubital fossa include
Questions.explanation:
The roof of the cubital fossa is formed by: 
 1. Skin 
 2. Superficial fascia containing the median cubital vein joining the cephalic and basilic veins 
 3. Deep fascia 
 4. Bicipital aponeurosis

Questions.question: Branches of thoracoacromial artery include
Questions.explanation:
Branches of acromial artery include 
 1. Clavicular branch 
 2. Acromial branch 
 3. Deltoid branch 
 4. Pectorial branch

Questions.question: Which of the following contribute to anastomosis on the subscapular fossa
Questions.explanation: The Dorsal Scapular artery and the subscapular artery contribute to the anastomosis on the subscapular fossa

Questions.question: Muscles responsible for abduction of the shoulder joint include the following except
Questions.explanation:
Abduction of shoulder joint is performed by 
 1. Supraspinatus(0°- 15°) 
 2. Deltoid (15°-100°)
 3. Upper fibers of Trapezius (>90°) 
 4. serratus Anterior(>100°)

Questions.question: The following are incorrect about the elbow joint except
options: It is a hinge type of synovial joint
The capitulum articulates with the trochlea
Head of radius aritculates with olecranon fossa
It is continous with superior radioulnar joint
Questions.explanation: The Elbow joint is a hinge type of synovial joint between the lower end of humerus and the upper end of radius and ulna. The elbow joint is a term used for humeroradial (capitulum of humerus articulating with upper surface of head of radius) and humeroulnar joint (trochlea of the humerus articularting with trochlea notch of the ulna). The elbow joint is continous with the radioulnar joint

Questions.question: which of the following is correct about carrying angle
options: Transverse axis of the elbow joint is directed medially and downward
The medial flange of the trochlea is lower than the lateral flange
The superior articular articular surface of the coronoid process of process of ulna is oblique
Questions.explanation:
Carring angle is the angle between extended forearm and arm. Its about 13 degrees with the transvers axis of the elbow joint which is directed medially an downwards. The factors responsible for formation of the carrying angle are as follows 
 1. The medial flange of the trochlea is 6mm deeper than the lateral flange 
 2. The superior articular surface of the coronoid process of the ulna is placed  oblique to the long axis of the bone. 
 The carrying angle disappears in full flexion of the elbow and also during pronation of the forearm

Questions.question: The contents of the upper triangular space include the following except
Questions.explanation: The content of the upper triangular space is the circumflex scapular artery

Questions.question: The contents of the quadrangular space includes
Questions.explanation:
The content of the quadrangular space includes 
 1. Axillary nerve 
 2. Posterior circumflex humeral artery

Questions.question: Lymph from the breast drain into
Questions.explanation:
About 75% of lymph from the breast drains into the axillary lymph nodes mainly the anterior group, 
 Lymph from the medial half of the breast drain to the parasternal (or internal mammary )node(which is about 20%),
 Some may drain directly or indirectly to supraclavicular and cephalic(deltopectoral/infraclavicular) node 
 While about 5% follow the intercoastal arteries to drain into the posterior intercostal nodes

Questions.question: concerning canal of Schwalbe
options: It can also be called hiatus of Schwalbe
It can also be called pocket of Schwalbe
It arises as a tendious gap between the arcus tendinous
It is a potential site of herniation

Questions.question: Concerning urogenital triangle
options: It is bounded by pubic symphysis
It is bounded by ischiopubic rami
Structurally, the triangle is a simple type
Perineal membrane is absent in the triangle
Questions.explanation: The Urogenital triangle is an area btw the Ischiopubic rami and in front of a horizontal line joining the anterior ends of two ischial tuberosities, it contains superficial and deep pouch. The Superfial perineal pouch is separated from the deep perineal pouch by the perineal membrane

Questions.question: The following are content of deep perineal pouch in female
Questions.explanation:
The content of the deep perineal pouch in females include
 1. Deep transverse perineal muscle 
 2. Sphinter urethra muscles 
 3. vagina and urethra 
 4. branches of the internal pudendal artery(ateries to clitories) 
 5. Branches of pudendal nerve(dorsal nerve of the clitoris)

Questions.question: The following are component of external female genitalia
The following about the pelvis are important in obstetrics except
options: The size and shape of the pelvis outlet
The size and shape of the pelvic inlet
The prominence of the ischial spine
Questions.explanation:
In obstetrics the following pelvic measurement are important
 1. size and shape of plevic inlet and outlet 2. Prominence of the ischial spine, and age of the woman

Questions.question: The following are true about the platypelloid pelvis
options: It has a narrow pelvic outlet
The baby finds it difficult to engage
Questions.explanation: Platepelliod( flat pelvis) has its transverse diameter much greater than its anterior posterior diameter (i.e it is compressed anteriorposteriorly). It posses difficulty in delivery

Questions.question: The following are true about the urinary bladder except
options: It is lined with transitional epithelium
Its base is the posterior surface
Its neck is in the superior surface
Its trigone is at its base
Detrusor muscle is the smooth muscle
Questions.explanation:
The Urinary bladder is lined by transitonal epithelium. 
 it has  a 
 1. base(or posterior surface. it contains the trigone) 
 2 neck(lowest and most fixed part of the bladder. It is situated where the inferolateral and the posterior surfaces of the bladder meet) 
 3. Apex (situated at the anterior superior part of the bladder. It contains the medial umblical ligament) 
 4. Destrusor muscle as its smooth muscle

Questions.question: The following are true about the uterus
options: The fundus is the part below the entrance of the fallopian tubes
The muscle of teh uterus plays a role in control of hemostasis
The edothelial thickness varies with stage in the menstal cycle
The mucosa of the cervix does not undergo cyclical changes

Questions.question: The pudendal canal
options: is also known as the Alcock's canal
lines the lateral wall of the ischioanal fossa
covers the medial aspect of the obturator internus muscle
contains the internal pudendal artery and vein
contains the internal pudendal nerve and nerve to obturator internus

Questions.question: The following are true about urogenital triangle
options: is posterior to the perineal body
the deep perineal pouch lies between the inferior and superior urogenital fascia
It consist of mainly the internal genitalia
The superficial perineal pouch lies between the skin and the superfical perineal muscles
Questions.explanation:
The urogenital triangle is anterior to the perineal body.
 The deep perineal pouch lies between the Superficial fascia of urogenital diaphram and the perineal membrane
 it is pierced by urethra in males and urethra and vagina in females
 it consist of mainly the external genitalia
  The superifial perineal pouch lies between the Colles'(superficial perineal) fascia and perineal membrane

Questions.question: The following are true about the penis
options: The root is attached to the superior surface of the perineal membrane
The bulb is continous with the anterior surface of the corpus spongiosus
The dorsal vein lies superior to the deep fascia of the penis
Teh corpora cavernosum lie dorsal to teh corpus spongiosus

The pelvic measurement from the retro-public eminence to the promotory of sacrum is/are
Questions.explanation: Obstetrical conjugate is the shortest distance between the pelvic surface of the pubic symphysis and sacral promotory

involved in the movement of the eye in the vertical or horizontal axes only

Diplopia does not arise as a result of injury to the nerve supplying the extra ocular muscle

options: The maxillary artery is the largest of the two terminal branches of external carotid artery

it provides a major site for mandibular nerve block

Occipitalis pulls the scalp posteriorly and wrinkle the skin at the back of the neck
The 1st three layers of the scalp are connected intimately and they move as a unit especially when wrinkle the forehead

Blood supply to the scalp is from external carotid arteries through occipal, posterior auricular and superficial temporal arteries and the internal carotid arteries and the internal carotid arteries through the supratrochlear of supraorbital arteries
Anterior to the auricle the innervations is through branches of all three division of trigeminal nerves

Questions.question: Infrahyoid group of muscles include except
Questions.explanation: The infrahyoid muscles include omohyoid, thyrohyoid, sternohyoid and sternothyroid

Questions.question: Suprahyoid muscles include the following
Questions.explanation: The suprahyoid muscles include mylohyoid, digastric, geniohyoid and stylohyoid

Questions.explanation: The layers of the Cardiac wall includes Endocardium, Myocardium and Epicardium(or visceral layer of serous pericardium)

Questions.explanation: Glossopharyngeal nerve (CNIX), Vagus(CNX), Accesory nerve(CNXI), Hypoglossal(CNXII) arise from the medulla oblongata
